intro: Ochrus lathyroides, commonly known as the rock thistle, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its spiny, glandular leaves and purple to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny, arid environments. Its structure includes a stout, branching stem and is often found in Mediterranean climates. Ochrus lathyroides is adapted to withstand drought and has a long lifespan, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
